text: are you looking for a super super easy

a pinch of cinnamon what you need to do
is combine all these ingredients and
then boil it for one minute it's been a
minute now you want to combine your

evenly over and then just stir it to

nice and even and then it just needs to

it's just fold it back and then cut it

you're just gonna be so popular if you

I have one and a half cups of toasted

wrap these up in a little bit of

rolled oats in here and I'm adding a
half a cup of dried cranberries half a
cup of sliced almonds and then just stir
it around all right set that aside
in a saucepan you just need to heat some
ingredients together 1/2 a cup of
natural peanut butter put that into a
saucepan then 1/2 a cup of light brown
sugar 3 tablespoons of a neutral
flavored oil like a canola oil or a
safflower oil 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon
quarter teaspoon of salt stir it
together and then just bring both of
these things over to the stove because
this needs to just melt to combine
everything together what you need to do
over here is turn the proper burner on
let's
there add a tablespoon of water and then
you just want to heat it till it's
dissolved one of the other things that
binds this granola bar together is an
egg white separator
you want to stir your peanut butter
mixture until all lumps are out I'm
going to turn the heat off and then add
my egg white make sure you work really
quickly here because otherwise even as
you're staring at the hot sides of the
pan can cook the egg whites and then add
it directly into your oat mixture want
to do this pretty quickly because even
the amount of time that it's been in
there the egg white is starting to cook
on the sides stir it around so
everything gets moistened and then over
here you can see that I have an 8x8
baking dish scrape this into your baking
dish nice and even so it bakes evenly
and then put it into a 300 degree oven
until it's dry on top that'll take about
30 minutes once they're finished let
them cool in the pan for 10 minutes and
then lift them out using the parchment
paper and let them cool completely on a
wire rack cut it into 16 squares 4 by 4
they're small but they're tasty and
